page.title: 04COMMON LAND ECOLOGY STROUD
page.content: {Plant Count:}We chose a 10m square on a SE facing slope of calcareous grassland lying within the parish of Rodborough at map ref SO 855032.We used a 30cm square thrown over our shoulders to establish the intensity of plant growth.Grasses were not identified on this count.Total number of plants identified was 648. Yellow Rattle 285;Dwarf Thistle 87;Salad Burnet 66;Hawksbeard 49;Plantain 31;Horseshoe Vetch 29; Milkwort 28;Ribwort 20; Wild Thyme 16; Rock Rose 8;Cowslip 6;Orchid 6; Hawthorn 5; Dandelion 2; Buttercup 2; Mountain Ash 1;Oak 1. Whitebeam and Pyramidal Orchid were also identified.The count was taken in Mid-June.
